multiQuestions.question: What is a Family Type?
multiQuestions.answer: Instance types that have similar hardware specifications (CPU, vRAM, etc)

multiQuestions.question: What is a security group?
multiQuestions.answer: An instance level firewall allowing you to restrict Ingress and Egress traffic by specifying what traffic is allowed to communicate with that instance

multiQuestions.question: What are some options of a Security Group to restrict inbound and outbound communication to an EC2 instance?
multiQuestions.answer: Source, Ports, and Protocols

multiQuestions.question: What protocols are supported by ALB?
multiQuestions.answer: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SMTP, and NFS

multiQuestions.question: What protocols are supported by NLB?
multiQuestions.answer: TCP, TLS, UDP, TCP_UDP
wrongAnswers: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SMTP, and NFS

multiQuestions.question: Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) balances traffic to a(n)
multiQuestions.answer: Target Group

multiQuestions.question: EC2 Auto Scaling scales instances inside of a(n)
multiQuestions.answer: AutoScaling Group

multiQuestions.question: When ALB uses HTTPS, what is the type of server certificate used?
multiQuestions.answer: X.509 certificate

multiQuestions.question: What is Cross-Zone Load Balancing?
multiQuestions.answer: A setting for ELB. When enabled, ELBs will distribute traffic to targets across AZs evenly

multiQuestions.question: For Lambda, which policy determines what resources the function has access to while running?
multiQuestions.answer: Role Excecution Policies

multiQuestions.question: For Lambda, which policy determines which AWS resources are allowed to invoke your function?
multiQuestions.answer: Function Policy

multiQuestions.question: What is needed for your Lambda to communicate with AWS services within your VPC?
multiQuestions.answer: You need to toggle a setting in Lambda. And then give the Lambda additional execution roles (ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces, ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface) so that it can give resources in your VPC, ENIs (Elastic Network Interfaces), and the lambda will need to be attached to a private subnet, with an optional NAT Gateway to access public internet

multiQuestions.question: What is Unreserved Concurrency?
multiQuestions.answer: How many functions can be ran at the same time within a single region. By default it is 1,000

multiQuestions.question: What is Reserved Concurrency?
multiQuestions.answer: You can reserve, say, 50 functions, and now the Unreserved pool of functions is only 950
wrongAnswers: How many functions can be ran at the same time within a single region. By default it is 1,000

multiQuestions.question: What happens when you Throttle a Lambda?
multiQuestions.answer: Sets Reserved Concurrency of that function to 0. Meaning nothing can call it until you increase its Reserved Concurrency again to something greater than 0

multiQuestions.question: What is an Event Source?
multiQuestions.answer: The AWS Service that produces the event and triggers your Lambda

multiQuestions.question: How do you get an instance to run terminal commands during its first boot cycle?
multiQuestions.answer: Add the command to User Data

multiQuestions.question: What is an Invocation Type?
multiQuestions.answer: If the Lambda event is synchrounous or asynchrounous

multiQuestions.question: A Reserved Instance can only be reserved for what timeframe?
multiQuestions.answer: 1 or 3 years

multiQuestions.question: What is the difference between a Reserved Instance and a Scheduled Instance?
multiQuestions.answer: A Reserved Instance is used for a specific length of time, whereas a Scheduled Instance boots up at a specific time and then shuts back down
wrongAnswers: A Reserved Instance boots up at a specific time and then shuts back down, whereas a Scheduled Instance is used for a specific length of time
They are the same, but a Scheduled Instance is cheaper

multiQuestions.question: What does the ELB do to an EC2 instance when it fails a health check?
multiQuestions.answer: Removes it from the Target Group and stops sending it traffic
wrongAnswers: Destroys it and creates a new EC2 instance
Removes it from the AutoScaling group

multiQuestions.question: What does the EC2 AutoScaler do to an EC2 instance when it fails a health check?
multiQuestions.answer: Destroys it and creates a new EC2 instance
wrongAnswers: Removes it from the Target Group

multiQuestions.question: Which type of Elastic Load Balancer support is ideal for receiving inbound traffic from the clients outside the VPC, offers TLS termination, and advanced routing?
multiQuestions.answer: ALB

booleanQuestions.question: If an EC2 instance is stopped or terminated, ephemoral storage is lost
If an EC2 instance is rebooted, ephemoral storage is lost
For a Reserved Instance, it is cheaper to pay Partial Upfront than All Upfront
booleanQuestions.popup: It is better to pay All Upfront, sometimes up to 75% off! It is most expensive to pay nothing before use. Partial Upfront is in the middle pricing wise

booleanQuestions.question: By default, AWS Lambda encrypts your environment variables *after* the function has been deployed
By default, Lambda can access services in your VPC
booleanQuestions.popup: By default, Lambda can only access resources via the internet (such as S3)

booleanQuestions.question: When Lambda fails to handle a Synchronous Event, it will automatically retry the event 2 more times
booleanQuestions.popup: The source sending the Synchronous Event is responsible for retrying. Lambda will only retry *Asynchronous Events* 2 more times

booleanQuestions.question: For Lambda, poll based events are always synchrounous
Lambda is Serverless, event driven, and is cost affective
Key Pairs are used for connecting to EC2 instances, IAM, and other AWS resources
booleanQuestions.popup: Key Pairs are only used for connecting to EC2 instances

booleanQuestions.question: When referencing ELB, you should use its static host name (url). Not its underlying IP Address
An EBS volume is an example of ephemoral storage for an EC2 instance
booleanQuestions.popup: An EBS volume is an example of persistent storage

booleanQuestions.question: An EBS volume will maintain its data when disconnected from an EC2 instance
By default, data in an EBS Volume is backed up automatically to another EBS Volume within the same AZ

checkboxQuestions.question: An Instance Type consists of what paremeters?
What are some options to get an AMI (Amazon Machine Image)?
What are the different GLB types?
Which of these are some Instance Purchasing Options for EC2?
What is needed for your Lambda to communicate with AWS services within your VPC?
answers: A setting in Lambda needs to be enabled
Additional execution roles (ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces, ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface) so that Lambda can give AWS resources in your VPC ENIs (Elastic Network Interfaces)
Needs to be placed on a Private Subnet within the VPC (and given a NAT Gateway if it wants to speak to the public internet)
wrongAnswers: Needs to be placed on a Public Subnet within the VPC (and given a NAT Gateway if it wants to speak to the public internet)
Additional Function roles (ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces, ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface) so that Lambda can give AWS resources in your VPC ENIs (Elastic Network Interfaces)

checkboxQuestions.question: What are the different Tenacity options?
